subject: Re: [junit] Database Testing in JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Google for DbUnit. If you use an Object/Relational Mapper (ORM), I personally wouldn t use DbUnit for several reasons. But for SQL statements used in your
messageBody:
--- sherlocksridhar <sridharj_ap@...> wrote:
> Dear All,
>
> If you can simply point me so some good posts in
> this group or some
> links on Google, I will take it from there.
>
> Regards
> SherlockSridhar

Google for DbUnit.

If you use an Object/Relational Mapper (ORM), I
personally wouldn't use DbUnit for several reasons.
But for SQL statements used in your Java code it
should be a good choice. It is described on page 170
in the book JUnit Recipes by J.B. Rainsberger.
